details.content: Hearing on Congress-JD(S) plea against the appointment of BJP MLA and former speaker, KG Bopaiah as the pro term speaker begins in Supreme Court

details.title: Senior advocate Kapil Sibal tells SC that 'senior most' member of the house should be the pro term speaker
details.content:
Protem speaker at Karnataka assembly : Senior advocate Kapil Sibal tells SC that as per convention senior most member of the House should be the protem speaker but this was not followed in case of Boppaiah's appointment @NewIndianXpress

— kanusarda (@sardakanu_TNIE) May 19, 2018

Justice Bobde tells Sibal but there have been instances where the senior most MLA was not appointed as Pro tem speaker @NewIndianXpress

— kanusarda (@sardakanu_TNIE) May 19, 2018

details.title: Kapil Sibal refers to Bopaiah's role as pro term speaker in 2011 which was criticised by SC
details.content:
Sibal also referring to 2011 judgement of Supreme Court criticising Bopaih's role as Protem speaker @NewIndianXpress

— kanusarda (@sardakanu_TNIE) May 19, 2018

details.title: Floor test to be postponed?
details.content:
Justice Bobde: If Pro tem appointment has to be challenged, notice has to be issue, floor test might be postponed @NewIndianXpress

— kanusarda (@sardakanu_TNIE) May 19, 2018

Hearing on Congress-JD(S) plea challenging appointment of pro tem speaker KG Bopaiah: Kapil Sibal argues 'I am requesting that don't allow KG Bopaiah to take the floor test'.

— ANI (@ANI) May 19, 2018

Additional Solicitor General Tushar Mehta, appearing for the Governor tells SC that live recording of floor test would do live broadcast to ensure transparency @NewIndianXpress

— kanusarda (@sardakanu_TNIE) May 19, 2018

details.title: Hearing on Congress-JD(S) plea challenging appointment of pro tem speaker KG Bopaiah: Supreme Court says 'Live broadcast of floor test would be the best way to ensure transparency of proceedings.' (ANI)
KG Bopaiah will continue to be the pro tem speaker: SC
details.content:
Supreme Court rejects Congress-JD(S) plea challenging appointment of pro tem speaker KG Bopaiah, he will continue to be pro-tem speaker. #Karnataka pic.twitter.com/eMhgYgC0m9

— ANI (@ANI) May 19, 2018

Bench rises. Orders that let there be live telecast of the vote.

— Bar & Bench (@barandbench) May 19, 2018
SC says no other agenda should be in place, only floor test

In Vidhana Soudha, protem speaker KG Bopaiah has started administering oath to its new members of the Karnataka Assembly. Local Channels streaming it live. 5 members being administered at a time due to paucity of time. #KarnatakaFloorTest pic.twitter.com/C1WWr0I8pu

— Bar & Bench (@barandbench) May 19, 2018

details.title: Congress-JD(S) settles for live telecast to ensure fairness
details.content:
Most important objective was to establish transparency. Since the statement has come from ASG that live feed of proceedings would be given, we hope & trust there would be fairness. I have no doubt that the victory would be of Congress & JD(S): Abhishek Manu Singhvi #Karnataka pic.twitter.com/bIBCybpRxQ

— ANI (@ANI) May 19, 2018

The SC heard the pleas of the Congress, all their pleas have been rejected. The desperate attempts of Congress to remove him from post has failed. I think they are scared & did not even want a floor test in the first place: Mukul Rohatgi (ANI)
Ahead of floor test, section 144 has been imposed as a precautionary measure in Mangalore
